intro: Vismia rubescens var. longipilosa, commonly known as the hairy vismia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves with long, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, clustered yellowish-green flowers, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens and private collections.
